definition: to take charge of/to manage/department (under a ministry)

sentences.english: With their help, all the apples were picked and put back on the cart.
sentences.chinese: 侥幸的是，苏和汽车司机都没受伤。

sentences.english: It was very nice that the drivers called us "little Lei Feng"
sentences.chinese: 最让人高兴的是，司机叔叔称我们是小雷锋。

sentences.english: The taxi-driver had only three fares this morning.
sentences.chinese: 这个出租汽车司机今天上午只载了三个乘客。

sentences.english: And equipped with more than a decade has experienced drivers.
sentences.chinese: 并配备有十年以上驾龄，经验丰富的司机。

sentences.english: We stop at Pin Wu for lunch, but Sam and David never come down.
sentences.chinese: 中途，司机在平武停下车吃午饭，鹏和嫣没有下车。

sentences.english: The driver hastens next handlebar grandpa uprear, apologize again and again.
sentences.chinese: 司机赶忙下车把老大爷扶起，并连连道歉。

sentences.english: The rear seats are extremely comfortable and the L-shaped headrests improve the driver's rear view visibility.
sentences.chinese: 后座非常舒适的L型头枕改善司机的后视能见度。

sentences.english: Without this device, a lot of drivers would have very tired legs.
sentences.chinese: 没有制动助力器那么司机的腿会非常疲劳。

sentences.english: The driver is talkative and a good guide and had been working in Guangdong before.
sentences.chinese: 司机开朗，曾在广东打过工，一路是个好向导。

sentences.english: The driver clapped on the brakes but failed to stop in time.
sentences.chinese: 司机急忙踩住刹车，但没有及时把车停住。

sentences.english: Ma Xu is a long-distance driver.
Taxi-drivers expect you to give them at least 15 percent.
sentences.chinese: 出租车司机希望你给他至少15%的小费。

sentences.english: A cab was provided for driver and fireman, as in normal railway practice .
sentences.chinese: 按通常的铁路惯例，机车备有司机和司炉室。

sentences.english: As I arrived at the bus stop the driver opened his big manual hinged door.
sentences.chinese: 等我到了巴士站，司机用手拉开那道大铰链门。

sentences.english: Anything that keeps the driver's focus more on the road is a good idea.
sentences.chinese: 任何让司机更集中精力于道路上的东西都是好主意。

sentences.english: One driver was blooding and another was shut in the taxi.
sentences.chinese: 一位司机出血，另一位在出租车。

definition: traffic police/abbr. for 交通警察
to drive a vehicle for its owner (often as a paid service for sb who has consumed alcohol) (abbr. for 代理駕駛|代理驾驶[dai4 li3 jia4 shi3])/substitute driver (abbr. for 代駕司機|代驾司机[dai4 jia4 si1 ji1])
to pull up (stop one's vehicle)/to park/(of a machine) to stop working/to stall
unlicensed or unofficial taxi/unlicensed motor vehicle
